intro: Polyphragmon trichocaulon, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed polyphragmon, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which provide a unique texture and aid in water retention. Its yellow flowers are typically arranged in clusters, enhancing its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
